sense.name: perpetrate, carry out
sense.examples: Their gang committed bank robberies during the 1970s. They are trying to determine whether fraud was committed. The man committed suicide by jumping off a bridge. She confessed the sins she had committed to her priest.

sense.name: give, dedicate, pledge
sense.examples: She has committed her life to helping the poor. The town won't commit funds for a dog park. The U.N. has not decided whether to commit ground troops to assist. Treasury appears to be committed to a strong dollar.

sense.name: consign, entrust
sense.commentary: Syntax Is: NP1[agent] COMMIT NP2[patient] PP
sense.examples: The sergeant committed the private to cleaning latrines for punishment. The judge committed him to four years in prison. Sally thinks her neighbor should be committed. (consigned to a mental ward) They committed their souls to God. I am committing my fate into your hands.
